intro: Schiedeella trilineata var. crenulata, commonly known as the Three-ribbed Schiedea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet forest habitats, often on rocky or exposed slopes. It is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across the island of Hawaii. Its unique morphology and restricted range make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
